body: @junrao I made the change you requested. Tests pass locally.
LGTM apart from minor comment.
Sorry for the delay @ZoneMayor, I left a comment. Please let me know what you think.

@ijuma Yeah I read your comment in the JIRA ticket. My patch actually swallowed InterruptedException inside `AclChangedNotificaitonHandler.processNotification(..)`. Did I miss something here?

I will verify the fix by running `AclCommandTest`. This is a good point.

@lindong28 When I ran the test, I thought I had seen two different places where InterruptedException was an issue, but I am not 100% sure. It should be obvious if you run the test, hopefully.

Also, would you mind renaming `AclChangedNotificaitonHandler` to `AclChangedNotificationHandler` please (there's a typo in the current name)?
@Parth-Brahmbhatt changes look good, +1.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
Thanks for the latest patch. LGTM
Thanks for the patch. LGTM.
Thank you @lindong28.
https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/b098f677aec998600f42529b0755b8fd39e777ff includes this fix. Would you please close this PR (we can't do it sadly).
@ewencp, can you please close this since it's been integrated (PRs that don't target trunk have to be closed manually sadly).

Thank you for comment.
I'm closing this PR.

@Parth-Brahmbhatt, looks like this doesn't merge cleanly anymore due to https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/c44c898ec835bb16950137f831cbc18c6b8b82f5 . If you could fix the conflicts and fix the minor issue I pointed out (capitalising the logging statement), it seems like this is good to go.
Can you please close this PR then @MayureshGharat?
Thoughts @fpj?
In addition to @ewencp's point, there are now conflicts against trunk that must be resolved.
@gwenshap Any chance you could merge this tiny documentation fix?
Heads-up: conflicts need to be resolved before this can be merged.
Thanks for the PR. This has been fixed in the meantime. Would you mind closing the PR? (we cannot do it unfortunately).
Conflicts need resolving on this again unfortunately.
Conflicts need to be resolved on this branch before it can be merged.
@guozhangwang Do you want to check this PR again?
@eribeiro, can you please close this as it has been merged?
Conflicts need to be fixed again before this can be merged.
Does this change also fix the original issue where StopReplica request was taking a long time? It would be interesting to know before/after numbers.
What was the conclusion with regards to the message? As it is, this PR is already an improvement, so it would be good to include it. If we can be a bit more specific, even better.
Did you test the producer with small messages?
Also, for future reference it would be good to know the results of the test runs before/after (even if they are very similar) and the environment details (including Java version used).

@praveend Do these actually guarantee we maintain compatibility between versions? It looks like it only ensures that, within a given version, we can serialize/deserialize. Don't we need to be sure not only that, e.g., `OffsetAndMetadata` in 0.9.1 can serialize/deserialize, but also that any newer versions of Kafka (e.g. 0.9.2) can still deserialize data generated by 0.9.1.

@ijuma Thoughts on this? @praveend probably understands the details of the need for Spark better than either of us, but once we mark this serializable, I'd like to know what we're committing to and set expectations for compatibility.

@ewencp @ijuma Rebased the pull request and remove the unused exception. It was left over from trying to migrate to the errors package and then realizing we could not maintain compatibility if we removed the old ones.
@ijuma we did some tests on a 32 GB partition it took max 1 sec for the markDelete operation. With the existing trunk it takes around 6 to 7 seconds to delete the partition.
@ijuma do you mean we should include the "requesting metadata" part in the message?
@ijuma Thanks for letting me know. It is rebased now.
@ijuma I will try to upmerge and address your comments today.

I'm wondering if it is the root cause of KAFKA-2937? Furthermore, if the deletion of the topic and shutdown of the broker were happening at the same time, shouldn't we blocks the shutdown but first delete the topic, then proceed with the shutting down?

@guozhangwang I think the blocking shutdown of broker might be possible but the scenario here would be for a crash that might happen while delete is in progress. Also this happens on the controller. The assumption is that even if one controller dies, the new controller should take over.
@MayureshGharat Thanks. The original issue was talking about StopReplica request (which calls delete/markDelete) though, right? Do you have timings for the whole stop replica request?

@MayureshGharat Yes, I was asking if there was a conclusion on whether we should include that part or not. It would be good to get @gwenshap's input since she asked for it and she would be able to merge this if she's happy with it. :)
@ijuma @fpj @harshach upmerged and addressed the comment.
@ewencp I adjusted the build to only create/publish the test jars if there are test sources.

@ijuma @gwenshap I updated the wiki page, but still left a reference to the old tool. Should we remove the old tool wiki pages and references all together? or leave them for archives sake? 
ex: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/Patch+Review+Tool
@gwenshap @ewencp Could either you take a look? @ijuma and I have reviewed.

@dajac It looks like the client code changes are not backward compatible. I think this patch either needs to be server side only, or if the clients are going to be updated, they need to be done so in a backward compatible way.

I could be wrong, as we have not had the discussion yet on the mailing list, but I think the idea is to deprecate the older Scala producers and consumers. I am not sure if its worth the effort of updating the client code. (context can be found in the comments on [KAFKA-2982](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-2982))
LGTM. Merging to trunk.
@rajinisivaram I had a look at the changes, they look good. I've left couple of questions above.

Looking at the JIRA for this PR, it looks like @gwenshap suggested that the JIRA was about removing k.a.Producer{Request, Response} altogether and that is why @dajac did this. But the producer is indeed public API and it is not yet deprecated so I think we can't do that for the upcoming release.

My suggestion is to only update the server-side and leave the soon to be deprecated clients alone (as @granthenke has suggested too, if I understand correctly).
@ijuma sure, this patch is waiting on @gwenshap's input, if she agrees with the explanation above. I am happy to submit another patch if required.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM.
LGTM. Merging to trunk.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
Thanks Parth. If the tests pass, seems like this could be merged @harshach.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
LGTM -- looks like the uploadArchivesAll target now works properly again.
@granthenke Sorry, looks like you'll have to fix conflicts once again.

Hi @ewencp 

> > Do these actually guarantee we maintain compatibility between versions?<<

Yes this test ensures that. I have a serialized version of the object written to file under resources folder. The de-serialization is happening from this file...hence if something changes in the new version of the class any incompatibility should be caught and de-serialization will fail (as de-serialization is still trying to use the older serialized object in file). [Reference: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/711/files#diff-27ca9bff4a10c02a25a24444543cd0d2R47 , https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/711/files#diff-6bc22032fe7eb6feeff4a86849a24c76R47]
@ijuma Not a problem. Its quick to rebase.

@junrao I will set log.cleaner.delete.retention.ms back to a day. 

The MiB wasn't a typo but a habit of mine. I understand its not necessarily used everywhere but its technically accurate: 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mebibyte

> The unit was established by the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) in 1998. It was designed to replace the megabyte, which is still being used in many contexts to represent 2<sup>20</sup> bytes, which is incompatible with the definition of the prefix mega in the International System of Units (SI) as a multiplier of 10<sup>6</sup>.
> 
> The binary prefixes have been accepted by all major standards organizations and are part of the International System of Quantities. Many Linux distributions use the unit, but it is not yet widely published within the industry or media.

Happy to change it if you prefer to stick with MB.
LGTM, thanks for all the work on this @granthenke!

@granthenke @ijuma Indeed, the `SyncProducer` part is not backward compatible. Making it backward compatible requires to keep the old produce request so it doesn't make sense to upgrade it to the new one. As you both suggested, it is better to not upgrade it.

I'll update the PR to reflect this.
Review by @ewencp
@granthenke I think we should be consistent with the rest of the code when it comes to MB versus MiB and it seems we use the former pretty much everywhere.
@junrao @ijuma Rebased and updated based on comments

@ijuma LGTM. Should we start a section in the README with available options? When we added maxParallelForks we continued the trend of adding examples, but as we add more simple options like this it might make sense to just have a list in the README.
Good point, will do.

Thanks for the patch. LGTM

@ijuma : Do you know why the jenkins job didn't run the unit tests on this PR?
@junrao Good question, I have no idea why it didn't run. Looks like a bug somewhere in the pipeline (doesn't seem to happen often).
@granthenke @ijuma I have rebased and updated it. Could you review it when you have time? All tests pass locally.
Thanks for the update. I did a quick visual check and will follow up with a more in depth review likely tomorrow.

@ijuma Thats right. I don't have the timing for the stopReplica , but I can run another test and get it :)
Would have to wait for the data to fill up in the partitions.
@MayureshGharat That would be good to know in order to understand if KAFKA-1911 can be closed with this PR alone or if additional work is needed.
@guozhangwang: Thanks for the feedback. I've rebased this PR as you requested, and I'm looking forward to your review.
LGTM overall. Left some minor comments.
@granders @guozhangwang pinging again for review. I just rebased it over latest trunk. Thanks!

@ewencp @granders @benstopford 

I have run the tests on jenkins:

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_systest_branch_builder2/30

and two tests failed. They aren't tests we've touched, so I wonder if they're known to be failing, in particular for the first test below:

```
test_id:    2016-01-07--001.kafkatest.tests.replication_test.ReplicationTest.test_replication_with_broker_failure.security_protocol=SSL.failure_mode=clean_shutdown.broker_type=leader
status:     FAIL
run time:   1 minute 24.576 seconds

test_id:    2016-01-07--001.kafkatest.sanity_checks.test_console_consumer.ConsoleConsumerTest.test_version
status:     FAIL
run time:   39.358 seconds
```
@guozhangwang: updated the PR with fixes per your comments above.
Merged to trunk. Thanks @rhauch for your patience!
@ymatsuda Removed toStream(ValueMapper).

@fpj I think the second one was one I saw when testing some stuff related to running in Docker and later discovered seemed to be failing on Jenkins. It looks like different, but similar, tests are failing here on trunk: http://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_0_9_0_system_tests/61/console I'm not sure about the first failure you saw.

I'm noticing now that I think we're not alerting anything on those trunk system tests -- only on the 0.9.0 branch tests. It looks like something's been wrong for awhile, but nobody was pinged about it...
Oops, sorry, this is the link that has `ConsoleConsumerTest.test_version` failing: http://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_system_tests/79/console

@ewencp This is actually what caused the failure of the first test case:

```
INFO  - 2016-01-07 19:45:03,270 - background_thread - _protected_worker - lineno:41]: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/kafka_systest_branch_builder2/kafka/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ducktape-0.3.8-py2.7.egg/ducktape/services/background_thread.py", line 37, in _protected_worker
    self._worker(idx, node)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/kafka_systest_branch_builder2/kafka/tests/kafkatest/services/verifiable_producer.py", line 61, in _worker
    node.account.ssh("mkdir -p %s" % VerifiableProducer.PERSISTENT_ROOT, allow_fail=False)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/kafka_systest_branch_builder2/kafka/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ducktape-0.3.8-py2.7.egg/ducktape/cluster/remoteaccount.py", line 78, in ssh
    return self._ssh_quiet(self.ssh_command(cmd), allow_fail)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/kafka_systest_branch_builder2/kafka/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ducktape-0.3.8-py2.7.egg/ducktape/cluster/remoteaccount.py", line 209, in _ssh_quiet
    subprocess.check_output(cmd, shell=True, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 566, in check_output
    process = Popen(stdout=PIPE, *popenargs, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 710, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1223, in _execute_child
    self.pid = os.fork()
OSError: [Errno 12] Cannot allocate memory
```

It's unrelated to the change here, and it is kind of weird, have you seen it happening before?

For the changes here, do you still see any issue we need to sort out before checking it in?

@fpj I haven't seen that specifically, but it sounds like it is just a resource issue -- looks like the host was running out of memory, which can happen if VMs are eating up too much memory on an old clunker laptop :)

The patch LGTM, I just wanted to see that last change to `use_authorizer`. Running a few tests locally here and then will commit.

@praveend Sorry, I must have scanned over the test too quickly and missed that there were separate files there instead of just serializing + deserializing.

@ijuma Any further thoughts here given the tests? I think we'll now have enough to catch any regressions or changes in (de)serializability, so I think this just amounts to deciding whether we want to commit to maintaining the serializability. For these two classes, it doesn't seem particularly onerous.
I had a look and left some comments. Looks good generally.
LGTM
@ijuma Thanks for your review.
@granthenke @ijuma I did a first pass and addressed all your reviews. Thanks for you input.
I agree this is a bug, basically on the line of `else if (!oldLeaderOpt.isDefined)`. Will wait for the unit tests to pass.
Thanks @smalldirector , LGTM and merged to trunk. It will be reflected in the next release in kafka-site.
Was this ever resolved? Would definitely be a nice feature to be added.
@ewencp I introduced a list of options to the readme as you suggested. Let me know what you think.
LGTM.
